content:
It is difficult to state with certainty how many Popes in history were not responsible for the persecution of Christians, as the historical record is not always clear on the actions of individual Popes and the context in which they occurred. However, based on the available historical records, it appears that some Popes who were not known to have been directly responsible for the persecution of Christians include:

1. Pope Sylvester I (314-335)
2. Pope Damasus I (366-384)
3. Pope Leo I (440-461)
4. Pope Gelasius I (492-496)
5. Pope Hormisdas (514-523)
6. Pope Vigilius (537-555)
7. Pope Agatho (678-681)
8. Pope John VII (705-707)
9. Pope John XIII (965-972)
10. Pope John XV (985-996)
11. Pope Sylvester II (999-1003)
12. Pope John XVII (1003)
13. Pope John XVIII (1003-1009)
14. Pope Sergius IV (1009-1012)
15. Pope Benedict VIII (1012-1024)
16. Pope John XIX (1024-1032)
17. Pope Benedict IX (1032-1044, 1045, 1047-1048)
18. Pope Sylvester III (1045)
19. Pope Gregory VI (1045-1046)
20. Pope Clement II (1046-1047)
21. Pope Damasus II (1048)
22. Pope Leo IX (1049-1054)
23. Pope Victor II (1055-1057)
24. Pope Stephen IX (1057-1058)
25. Pope Nicholas II (1058-1061)
26. Pope Alexander II (1061-1073)
27. Pope Gregory VII (1073-1085)
28. Pope Victor III (1086-1087)
29. Pope Urban II (1088-1099)
30. Pope Paschal II (1099-1118)
31. Pope Gelasius II (1118-1119)
32. Pope Callistus II (1119-1124)
33. Pope Honorius II (1124-1130)
34. Pope Innocent II (1130-1143)
35. Pope Celestine II (1143-1144)
36. Pope Lucius II (1144-1145)
37. Pope Eugene III (1145-1153)
38. Pope Anastasius IV (1153-1154)
39. Pope Adrian IV (1154-1159)
40. Pope Alexander III (1159-1181)
41. Pope Lucius III (1181-1185)
42. Pope
